messages.subject: RE: homeschooling teenagers
messages.msgSnippet: homeschooling teenagers Funny, this is how I felt in PS.
messages.messageBody:
homeschooling teenagers<without exception the teenagers were very, very
lonely and isolated>

Funny, this is how I felt in PS.

<1. Religious Fanatics
2. the Wheatgrass and Newage crowd
3. The people like ourselves who read about homeschooling and thought
it sounded great from a philisophical stand point.>
I find it hard to believe that this woman ONLY met the kinds of people she
describes. I guess what she's saying is that if you're not in cateogry 1 or
2 you have to be in 3. How weird! I feel sorry that this woman could not
find any friends. Sounds like a problem with her not with homeschooling.

I'm wondering if this is a true former homeschooler or just someone faking
it.

Amy
Mom to Carlos (6) and Sasha (4)

messages.subject: Re: homeschooling teenagers
messages.msgSnippet: Sounds like a very unhappy woman...who didn t meet the right people for the right reasons... there s no convincing unhappy, spitefull people--there will
messages.messageBody:
Sounds like a very unhappy woman...who didn't meet the right people for the
right reasons...
there's no "convincing" unhappy, spitefull people--there will always be
people like that...unfortunately
Hopefully the people considering hsing will see how sad and hatefull she is
and just chalk it up to "people who disagree" and strive for a better life
for themselves and their children...

Diana a.
"the world is our classroom"
